meanings.definition: A prearranged combat between two persons, fought with deadly weapons according to an agreed-upon set of rules.
meanings.sent1: The duel between the knights was intense and ended quickly.
meanings.sent2: The duel at dawn was a traditional way to settle disputes.
meanings.sent3: During the duel, they realized they were using toy swords by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The duel of wits between the siblings was entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent5: In the duel, the clang of swords echoed through the courtyard.

meanings.definition: A contest between two parties or individuals.
meanings.sent1: The spelling duel between the students was a close competition.
meanings.sent2: The political duel for the presidency was fierce and well-publicized.
meanings.sent3: The duel for the last piece of cake was settled by a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The duel of opinions in the debate was heated and passionate.
meanings.sent5: In the duel of strength, both athletes gave their all to win.
